divs: sighting detailsi am 60 years old with very good distant eye sight.i first saw an object 35 years ago above hills near a village called horsepath near oxford england,i looked out of my bedroom window to see a dark object in a uniform grey sky,it appeared to have a rough outline[not sharp]i later saw a photo in a book very similar which said it was a fake?from that point i looked to the sky more and about two months later i saw two orange orbes of light in almost the same area as before,over a period of about 20 min they came together separated came together[as one]separated then slowly drifted off beyond the hills.i saw nothing until about five years later when i saw an object pass from right to left between trees[see black\white photo]then the object over west norwood[south london]england,this time i had a good camera with an 18x telephoto lense,also on camcorder but due to max close up my every movement ment that the object appeared to move around a great amount.i believe all these reports are a waste of timebecause if these objects come from another world they will do what they will,it is no use to say "why dont they land on the grass at the white house if they are real"what is the point of applying our logic and parameters[perhaps they have infinite patience-after seeing our uncivilized anticts why should they wish to]though i believe that if it appears we may take our insanity closer to them they will prevent this.i have an interest in aircraft[i have visited air shows for many yearsi i do not think that i can be fooled by conventional craft,satellites,planets,birds etc:i do not know if the governments of the world have anything to hide perhaps not,i do not believe these are secret aircraft[they dont stay secret for long.
Summary: High in the sky, clear/light cloud , appeared still but slow movement not easy to detect hence 20 min. to reach horizon.
trends: There have been 91 other sightings in London
There were no other sightings in London on or around November 30th 2002
This sighting has never been favorited.
